body:
Comment 12: 
I'm sorry, I'm not sure I really understand the question.  And perhaps this should go to
the mailing list anyhow.

The import path for any package is set by the string used to import it.  The main
package--the one that runs the program--is never imported.  So there is no string to
use.  Therefore, we use "main".  What else should we use?

I think you are asking why, if the main package is imported, that does not set the
package for the main package that runs the program.  But if the main package is
imported, it is not the package running the program, by definition.  It's a different
package, an imported one.  In the imported main package, the main function is not
special.
